content.question: A student prepared four solutions of known <math alttext="the molar concentration of C u with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><msup><mi>Cu</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></math> and measured the absorbance of each solution using the same cuvette. The graph shows the data for two absorbance measurements done for each solution. Which of the following identifies the most likely error that affected the absorbance recorded for the solution with <math alttext="the molar concentration of C u with a positive 2 charge, is approximately equal to 7 times 10 to the negative 3 power, molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><msup><mi>Cu</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">]</mo><mo>≈</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></math> in the second trial?

choices.label: The cuvette was rinsed with water between measurements.
A fingerprint was left on the side of the cuvette facing the detector.

The absorbance was measured at a wavelength where <math alttext="C u with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>Cu</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> has a lower molar absorptivity.
The cuvette was not filled with the same volume of solution.

content.answer: A fingerprint was left on the side of the cuvette facing the detector.

skill.text: 2.F: Explain how modifications to an experimental procedure will alter results.
